Package io.dimeformat

Class Data

java.lang.Object
io.dimeformat.Item
io.dimeformat.Data
Direct Known Subclasses:
Message
public class Data extends Item
DiME item that carries a data payload. The payload may be any data.

  • Constructor Details

    • Data

      public Data​(UUID issuerId)
      Creates a new Data instance with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The identifier of the issuer, must not be null.

    • Data

      public Data​(UUID issuerId, long validFor)
      Creates a new Data instance with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The identifier of the issuer, must not be null.
      validFor - Number of seconds the data item should be valid, if -1 is provided, then it will never expire.

    • Data

      public Data​(UUID issuerId, String context)
      Creates a new Data instance with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The identifier of the issuer, must not be null.
      context - The context to attach to the data item, may be null.

    • Data

      public Data​(UUID issuerId, long validFor, String context)
      Creates a new Data instance with the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      issuerId - The identifier of the issuer, must not be null.
      validFor - Number of seconds the data item should be valid, if -1 is provided, then it will never expire.
      context - The context to attach to the data item, may be null.

  • Method Details

    • getHeader

      public String getHeader()
      Description copied from class: Item
      Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
      Specified by:
      getHeader in class Item
      Returns:
      The item header of the DiME item.

    • setPayload

      public void setPayload​(byte[] payload)
      Sets the data payload of the item.
      Parameters:
      payload - The payload to set.

    • setPayload

      public void setPayload​(byte[] payload, String mimeType)
      Sets the data payload of the item.
      Parameters:
      payload - The payload to set.
      mimeType - The MIME type of the payload, may be null.

    • getPayload

      public byte[] getPayload()
      Returns the data payload set in the item.
      Returns:
      The message payload.

    • sign

      public void sign​(Key signingKey) throws CryptographyException
      Description copied from class: Item
      Will sign an item with the proved key. The Key instance must contain a secret key and be of type IDENTITY.
      Overrides:
      sign in class Item
      Parameters:
      signingKey - The key to sign the item with, must be of type IDENTITY.
      Throws:
      CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

    • verify

      public IntegrityState verify​(Key verifyKey, List<Item> linkedItems)
      Description copied from class: Item
      Verifies the integrity and over all validity and trust of the item. If a key is provided, then verification will use that key. If verifyKey is omitted, then the local key ring will be used to verify signatures of the item.
      Overrides:
      verify in class Item
      Parameters:
      verifyKey - Key used to verify the item, may be null.
      linkedItems - A list of item where item links should be verified, may be null.
      Returns:
      The integrity state of the verification.
